TopicTitle: What kind of Hardware do you use to run KSP

Articles.Content:
Core i7-950 + Gigabyte GA-X58A-UD3R board

12 GB RAM (yeah, I know, 32 bit)

NVidia GTX-760

I really wish the game would go to a multi-threaded, 64-bit model. While the GPU is newer, my system is about 3 years old. It's behind the times a little, but it's no slouch either. But I still get some ugly frame rates with larger vehicles, or docking space stations.

i5-2500k

8GB Ram

nVidia GTX 670 2GB by Gigabyte

CPU: AMD Phenom x4 II 965

RAM: 16Gb

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 770 by EVGA

Still on old-fashioned hard drives, but I'm looking into SSDs.

Intel Dual Core Pentium E2140 @ 1.6GHz

1 GB

Intel 946GZ Intergrated Graphics

Haven't seen any more than 30 or so fps since the new terrain system

Operating System
			Windows Vista Home Basic 32-bit SP2
		CPU
			AMD Athlon Neo MV-26
			Huron 65nm Technology
		RAM
			2.00GB Dual-Channel DDR2 @ 321MHz (6-6-6-18)
		Motherboard
			eMachines WMCP61M (Socket AM2 )	35 Ã‚Â°C
		Graphics
			HP W2071d (1600x900@60Hz)
			256MB NVIDIA GeForce 6150SE nForce 430 (Acer Incorporated [ALI])
		Hard Drives
			149GB Hitachi HDT721016SLA SCSI Disk Device (SATA)	47 Ã‚Â°C
		Optical Drives
			HL-DT-ST DVDRAM GH40F SCSI CdRom Device
			MagicISO Virtual DVD-ROM0000
		Audio
			Realtek High Definition Audio

CPU:2.9GHz Intel Pentium G2020

RAM: 12 GB 1333mHz

GPU: Nvidia GeForce GT 630

Storage: Seagate 7200RPM HDD, 500GB

OS (64-bit): Mac OS X 10.9; I also have Windows 7 and Ubuntu Linux, but OS X is my primary OS

Monitor: HP W2071d

Keyboard: Logitech K360

Mouse: Logitech M325

Headphones: Sony MDR-ZX100 Stereo

Overview: For a budget build, it's surprisingly capable. I'm not able to do what Whackjob does, but KSP generally runs smoothly at decent quality. I can even stream KSP, albeit at 480p and around 15 FPS with the lowest graphics KSP can offer. I plan on eventually upgrading to an i5, but I want to get my money's worth out of the $60 Pentium.

Edited April 4, 2014 by OrbitusII

My custom rig has; i5 4670k cpu,

Msi gtx 770 twin frozr gpu, 4gb ram, 750WATT psu, msi z87-g45 gaming mb, and a 1TB hardrive. And a tonne of fans. My ksp runs at a solid 80fps until I pass 150 parts.

iMac i7 early 2013 27"

32 Gigs Ram

2 Gig NVidia 680 MX

3 TB Fusion Drive

Saitek Cyborg 3D Joystick

and i wish there would be Mac support for a 3Dconexxion Spacepilot Pro

CPU: Intel i5 2.8 GHz

RAM: 8 GB

GPU: Nvidia GeForce GT 525M 1GB RAM.

Non SSD, but probably won't be upgrading any time due to budget constraints. Able to run KSP at 1024x768, all settings on max, and no lag issues until I get up to about 150 parts.

Intel Core i5 2467m @1.6GHz

Nvidia GeForce GT-540m 1Gb

8Gb RAM

500Gb hard drive (mechanical, not SSD)

1366x768 display

Windows 7 64 bit

My Alienware M11xR3. Great little laptop, but I will have to upgrade a few months down the line because of Star Citizen, primarily (Hangar module runs... somewhat...)

Anyway, KSP runs fine for me at max settings. I get a smooth frame rate up to about 200 parts when it starts to slow down a bit, but my designs rarely exceed 300 parts.

2.8GHz Intel Q9300

AMD Radeon 7800

8GB RAM

Win7 64bit

In my experience ksp does not like v-sync.

On my rig with v-sync on the delta-physics thing kicks in (jittering green/yellow) with nothing more than a single probe core on the launchpad. All stock.

With v-sync off it's smooth up to at least a 100 parts. To bad about about the screen tearing.

ASRock B85-ITX

Pentium G3220

8 Gigs Ram

GTX 750 ti

This budget configuration plays KSP really well! I used to use my GTX 260 to play and could almost max out the graphics settings. With the GTX 750ti, everything is maxed out and runs really smooth. It is a great card to an upgrade too as it only uses around 60w and requires no axillary power connections.

CPU:I7 4770k,

GPU:780ti

ram:16 2100 mhz vengeance.

and the rest really doesn't affect the fps
Well first you should see what is causing the lag by putting different settings on and off.

Asus P6T Deluxe

Intel i7 720 (clocked to 3,66)

12 GB OCZ Ram

EVGA GTX 770 2 GB

1 GB Hybrid HDD

3 GB HDD

2 year old MacBook Pro. Awesome graphics, no lag whatsoever.

I know Macs are pricey, but they're a really good machine for KSP. Been playing KSP for two years now, and honestly am not even sure what lag looks like.

but they're a really good machine for KSP.

It all just really boils down to intel cpu's run the game pretty well.

phenom2 955

4G DDR3 1333

600G X2 7200rpm on RAID0

HD7850

Intel Core i5 2500k currently overclocked to 4GHz until I sort out some stability issues at 4.3+GHz,

2x GTX 760's in SLI

8GB of 1600MHz RAM

120GB System SSD

2x 500GB Storage HDDs

Its a really nice build that I've had for a while now, still runs games extremely well due to the dual 760's. All this wrapped up in a CoolerMaster Storm Enforcer, which is in my opinion, a really nice looking case.

Intel Core i7 [email protected]

GForce GTX670

16GB ram (hoping dev upgrade to 64bit game.)

Windows 7

Runs smooth, no lag

I'm mosing along with an old core2 duo e8700, 4gb memory and a gtx 260. *lol*

Can and does get laggy at times.

AMD 8320 8 core @4.2 GHz OC

ASUS M5A97 LE R2.0 Motherboard (Xfire capable)

8GB G.Skills Ripjaws 1866MHz RAM

Sapphire r9 270 2GB Video card

Windows 8.1 64bit

My first build in 8 years. New hardware specs were such a pleasant surprise.....

Intel Core i7 4770k, @ 4 GHZ

Gigabyte Z87X-UD4H motherboard

16 GB Corsair RAM, DDR3-2133

EVGA/NVidia GeForce GTX-760

Windows 7 Pro 64-bit

Laptop!

Intel Core i7-3530QM at 2.4GHZ

8GB DDR3

Nvidia GT640M

Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit

This manages around 60FPS with settings at medium, except when docking large ships.

For awhile I was running KSP on a laptop with an A6 chip and 4 Gb of ram.... And nowhere near smoothly. I got by with it. I currently have an AMD FX 9590 with an ATI HD 7800 graphics card. I have 16 Gb of RAM to go with that.... But KSP is only a 32 bit program, so it maxes out at 4 Gb of RAM. I just discovered this :http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/59005-0-23-5-Release-3-1-Active-Texture-Management-Save-RAM-without-reduction-packs%21/page140 and it runs even better (I have a lot of mods!) It seems to hang at the beginning, but it works very well. (I am a true believer after seeing what it did with my problems! Don't take my word for it, try it for yourself! =P)
